column5: Provide description on the current state of land use e.g. cities | farmstead | industrial areas | roads/railroads | rock | sand etc. Free text - 200 characters.
Provide description of previous land use and dates. Following examples above.  Free text - 500 characters.
Describe the method used in determining previous land use and dates.  Free text - 500 characters.
Vegetation classification using one or more standard classification systems. Free text - 200 characters.
Reference or method used in vegetation classification. Free text - 200 characters.
Unusual physical events that may have affected communities present. Free text - 500 characters.
Historical and/or physical evidence of fire. Provide date. Free text - 500 characters.
Historical and/or physical evidence of flooding. Provide date. Free text - 500 characters.
Whether or not crop is rotated. If yes - provide rotation status | date | period. Free text - 200 characters.
Addition of fertilisers | pesticides etc. Provide: agrochemical name | amount | time. Free text - 500 characters.
Method used for tilling e.g. drill cutting disc | ridge till | strip tillage | zonal tillage | chisel | tined | mouldboard | disc plough. Free text - 200 characters.
Additional relevant information. Free text - 1000 characters.

Specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath e.g. O horizon | A horizon | E horizon | B horizon | C horizon | R layer | Permafrost. Free text - 100 characters.
Method or reference used for determining horizon. Free text - 200 characters.
Collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved. Provide design name and/or size | amount. Free text - 200 characters.
Provide the water content of soil in cm3/cm3. Enter a decimal number only.
Method used to determine water content. Free text - 200 characters.
Explain how and how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction. Provide storage condition | duration. Free text - 400 characters.
Link to climate resource e.g. URL. Free text - 500 characters.
Mean annual and seasonal temperature. Provide temp in degrees Celsius. Enter a decimal number only.
Mean annual and seasonal precipitation. Provide temp in mm. Enter a decimal number only.
Soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources. Free text - 200 characters.
Soil classification based on local soil classification system. Free text - 200 characters.
Reference or method used in determining the local soil classification. Free text - 200 characters.
Link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information. Free text - 500 characters.
Soil series name or other lower-level classification. Free text - 200 characters.
Reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification. Free text - 200 characters.

The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent).  This is the direction that overland water would flow.  This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer. Enter a decimal number only.
The direction a slope faces. Provide direction in degrees where north is zero degrees. Enter an integer number only.

Cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas e.g. summit | shoulder | backslope | footslope | toeslope. Free text - 200 characters.
Drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system e.g. very poorly | poorly | somewhat poorly | moderately well | well | excessively drained.  Free text - 200 characters.

The relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil. As described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm) | silt (2 um to 50 um) | and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g. silty clay loam) optional. Free text - 300 characters.
Free text - 200 characters.
pH measurement. Enter an integer number only.
Method use to determine pH. Free text - 200 characters.
Total organic C content of the soil. Units are g C/kg soil.Enter decimal number only.
Method or reference used to determine total carbon content. Free text - 200 characters.
Total organic N content of the soil. Units are g N/kg soil. Enter decimal number only.
Method or reference used to determine total nitrogen content. Free text - 200 characters.
The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 Âµm. Correction factors are needed for conversion to the final units
column6: which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil). Enter decimal number only.

column5: Method used to determine microbial biomass.Free text - 200 characters.
Link to additional relevant information e.g. provide URL. Free text - 500 characters.
Measured salinity. Enter a decimal number only.
Method used to determine salinity in soil. Free text - 200 characters.
Heavy metal present and the concentration. Provide heavy metal name | concentration. Units are mg/kg soil. Free text - 200 characters.
Method used to determine concentration and presence of heavy metals. Free text - 200 characters.
The level of aluminium saturation in the soil. Units are mg Al/kg soil. Enter a decimal number only.
Method used to determine aluminium saturation in soil. Free text - 200 characters.
Weight of soil processed. Units are g. Enter a decimal number only.
Were multiple DNA extractions mixed? How many?. Provide number of mixed DNA extracts. Enter an integer number only.
